Fields.DialogueText: I don't know how you manage it, Captain.
Manage what, Lieutenant?
The Pacific Ocean is massive. We haven't seen land in days.
If I didn't know better, I'd say that was a complaint, Lieutenant.
Lady Naka. I swear, it was more of an observation than anything else.
Kanchou, I must respectfully state my objection to all forms of insubordination. Allow me to discipline this miscreant.
Sir. You know I didn't mean anything by it. Sir? Sir.

Fields.MenuText: He's all yours, Naka.
I believe that is unnecessary.
No need, I'll discipline the whelp myself.

Fields.DialogueText: Lieutenant, drop and give me fifty press ups.
Hai. Kanchou, I defer to your judgment.
Kanchou, you're an inspiration to your crew.
*ALARM*
Morganas approaching.
It seems your reprieve has been granted.
Battle stations.
@BATTLE
I swear I've never been so glad to hear sirens in my life.
You'd rather face Morganas than be reprimanded? You could have died. Luckily, Naka was so calm under fire.
She strikes fear into enemies and crew alike... Captain.
One of these days, Lieutenant, that mouth of yours will get you in serious trouble.
As long as that day isn't today, sir.
I've noticed that the deck's still the worse for wear after the battle. See that she's restored, as soon as possible.
Yes, Kanchou. Come on, Marks, before you really make a fool of yourself.
Do you hear that, Naka? The sound of men hard at work to clean this place up.
Hai, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Any other instructions for the crew?
We really handled that battle like a team. I look forward to working further with you.
Naka, the formality is not necessary.

Fields.DialogueText: Not at this time, Kanchou.
Hai.
Hai.
Lady Naka, is everything all right? You seem distant.
The battle drains me, Kanchou. If it is all right with you, I wish to retire to my quarters.
Please. By all means, you're dismissed.
I can never tell if she respects me or hates me...
*ALARM*
It seems your R&R has been cut short - I'll make it up to you.
The only thing I need is unquestioned victory.
@BATTLE
Funayūrei are approaching from the south, Kanchou.
You handled that last battle quite well. I especially admire how you directed fire from your fellow ships in the fleet.
Dōmo arigatō gozaimasu.
... Is something the matter?
Please, Kanchou. I don't wish to trouble you.
Naka, we can't work together if secrets hinder our ability to fight battles.
It's one of the ships of the fleet, sir. My sister, Sendai.
She didn't seem to be sustaining heavy fire.
That's not the issue, sir. She was... stirring.
Stirring?
All ships have a connection with the Nagano no Kami, the Belles. Sendai, however, felt, adrift.
The ship wasn't responding to you?
I can't quite state what the issue was, sir. In the heat of the battle, I couldn't concentrate on Sendai long enough...
Kanchou, Lady, we have a situation. The Morganas are circling back.
Everyone to the bridge. Naka, see if you can establish communication with Sendai.
@BATTLE
I noticed it too. Something seems off with Sendai.
Kanchou, our ability to wage war rests upon our cohesion as a unit. We must resolve the issue with Sendai.
It would be easier to solve if we knew what the issue was. We need more than "stirrings."
Do I detect sarcasm, Kanchou? I apologize if my spiritual nature has somehow angered you.

Fields.MenuText: Not at all, Naka. Your unique abilities as a Belle are priceless.
I simply wish we could find a concrete issue at play.
You'll know when I'm being sarcastic.

Fields.DialogueText: Gomen'nasai. I was too quick to take offense.
As do I, sir. Without my contact, we never would have known there was an issue.
You'll know when I tire of this banter.
It is imperative that we establish contact with Sendai. Perhaps even go aboard.
I disagree, Kanchou. Though she may be a ship of the fleet, we don't know what dangers await.
I suggest that we pull alongside her, to ascertain the situation. I need to get closer.
Navigator.
Kanchou, Lady Naka?
Set a course for the harbor of Saipan. Radio Sendai, get her to follow.
Hai.
I hope we know what we're doing.
I have faith in our ability.
*ALARM*
It's not our ability that worries me. It's that we can't catch a break.
To war.
@BATTLE
Ah, Saipan. It's nice to see land again after all this time.
I don't trust ports, Kanchou. Too many businesses prey on the weaknesses of sailors.
I heard there's an excellent fish market. The locals love the fatty tuna.
No fish will ever match the fresh salmon of my home – the Naka River.
Captain, Sendai has pulled into port. We radioed the captain to come aboard...
And?
May I speak to you in private?
Lieutenant, I won't force you to run laps for telling the truth.

Fields.MenuText: Take a quick break, Naka. It won't be long.
Naka, may we have five minutes?
You know, Naka, I think we have salmon in the mess hall.

Fields.DialogueText: If you think that's what's best for the mission.
Hai, Kanchou.
Please spare me the concern, Kanchou.
The captain of Sendai said he will only board if no Belle is on the bridge.
How was this man even commissioned? That's inexcusable. She's the spirit of the ship.
It's your call, sir. She may be intimidating, but that seems severe.
*ALARM*
Sir, Morganas are on the horizon and steaming towards Saipan. We have to act now to save the harbor.
Right when we pull into port. Naturally.
@BATTLE
Radio Sendai. Have them form up on our starboard. I'll meet with this captain after the battle.
Sir, Kanchou Noda of Sendai is on deck.
Excellent. Please escort him to my quarters.
Have you talked to Naka yet, sir?
Talked to me about what?
Yipes. Officer Furuichi, I think we're needed anywhere else but here. Duty calls.
Is this about Sendai, Kanchou?
I don't understand what this is about, but Captain Noda will only meet with me privately.
Kanchou, we can't work well together if secrets hinder our ability to fight battles.

Fields.MenuText: Turned my words against me?
I promise there will be no more secrets.

Fields.DialogueText: Has my point been made?
I sincerely hope so.
I hope what this captain has to say is worth the damage done to Naka.
@BATTLE
The kanchou of the cruiser Naka, I presume. What can I do for you?

Fields.MenuText: You can start by explaining why you felt the need to remove my Belle from this meeting.
Is something the matter with Sendai? My ship's kami has sensed "stirrings."
Would you care for some salmon?

Fields.DialogueText: Calm yourself, Kanchou. You're the one who called for the meeting. I don't need to be interrogated by a peer.
These "kami" have been nothing but trouble since their arrival...
I'll never turn down a meal, but I sense that you didn't ask me here only to dine.
The Belle Naka is keenly intelligent and excellent in battle. She claims something is amiss with Sendai, and I believe her.
Inspect the ship if you want, Kanchou. Sendai hasn't been in better shape since her commissioning. Such a grand day that was.
You were at the commissioning of Sendai?
I've been with her in some working capacity since day one. The tenno himself was at the ceremony.
It must have been a great honor, having the Emperor oversee such an occasion.
It certainly was. Ever since, I have served Japan and my Emperor with utmost loyalty.
But these "Belles," these Nagano no Kami - I don't trust them.
Without them, we'd be blind in the Morgana mist. Probably choking to death as well.
I've defeated my share of Morganas on my own, and you shouldn't sell yourself short, either.
You have to admit they're an asset, at minimum.
They're a distraction. You know the Belles appeared at the same time as the Morganas. Whose side are they truly on?
The side of humanity, I believe.
I'm sorry, but my loyalty is to the nation of Japan, not humanity in general.
*ALARM*
Kanchou. Morganas approaching from the south.
What did I say about Belles? I must return to my ship.
We have no time.
Noda, you'll be safe here. We'll return you when the battle is through.
@BATTLE
Your skill is incredible. Terrifying, really.
If you or your crew ever need a demonstration, I'd be happy to come aboard.
Charming. I believe this is my time to disembark.
It was a pleasure to have you aboard. Please, radio me any time you need.
Remember what I told you. Don't trust everything those Belles say, regardless of how they handle in battle.
I'll keep that in mind, Captain Noda. Fair seas.
Something seems deeply wrong with that kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Can you keep a secret?
You wouldn't believe it if I told you.
Isn't there something charming about the erratic old man?

Fields.DialogueText: I would guard it like I do the lives on this ship.
Is that a challenge?
Are you hiding something from me, Kanchou?
Noda deeply distrusts the Belles. He seems to think you and the Morganas are a distraction.
How could he? A distraction...?
*ahem* I apologize. My temper got the best of me.
That was my reaction at first, too. He seems to only care about his duty to the Emperor.
His distrust is infecting Sendai. It's going to cripple our ability to wage war against the Morganas.
What is there to do? He's been with Sendai since she was commissioned. He's a seasoned veteran.
That's not my place to say, Kanchou. You're the leader of the ship– it is your responsibility to make the best decision for the crew.
*ALARM*
Morganas approaching.
The best decision is to engage. We will see to Sendai later.
Hai.
@BATTLE
Do we have a fixed eye on Sendai?
Yes, Kanchou. She remains in position in the battle group, no deviation.
Excellent, Furuichi. Your sense of duty brings you great honor.
Th-thank you, Lady Naka. I must return to my lookout.
If he's planning anything, he's not showing it.
Is it Noda?
Negative, Kanchou. Morgana fleet approaching, fast.
@BATTLE
Can we get a visual on Sendai?
Negative. All the smoke from the battle has obscured our view.
We need to clear this smoke immediately. Full steam ahead.

Fields.MenuText: Doesn't that seem a bit reckless, Naka?
Let's attempt radio communication first.

Fields.DialogueText: I can't stand the smoke or fog of war. I need a glass of water.
Understood, but I must retire to my quarters until the smoke passes.
Lieutenant Marks says no radio contact can be made.
The smoke is clearing. Do we have a visual on the rest of the fleet?
The stirrings are growing fainter. She's gone.
All accounted for except Sendai... she's vanished, sir.
These Morgana battles are rattling my bones. When will this end?
Complaining again, Lieutenant?
Lady Naka! I promise I do more than complain! You... just seem to catch me at my worst.
You seem proficient enough at radio communication. Anything from Sendai?
Nothing yet, but Officer Furuichi and I are hard at work.
Yes, the navigator. You two seem chummy. Keep it above board, Lieutenant.
Defeating the Morganas is my sole priority, Captain.
You look refreshed, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: Nothing like a nap to power the brain.
Nothing like a cup of coffee to power the brain.
Nothing like a brisk workout to power the brain.

Fields.DialogueText: I prefer a soak in the bath in my quarters.
I prefer a calming cup of green tea.
The heat of the battle is more than enough workout for me, Kanchou.
Have you felt anything from Sendai?
The faintest of stirrings, Kanchou. It doesn't matter which direction we sail.
We'll find her, I promise.
*ALARM*
I'm glad your brain is fully powered, Kanchou. We need your full attention.
Battle stations!
Attention! We are being raided! Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
These Morganas never stop coming. These battles are wearing me down. But I can't let the crew know.
Kanchou. No casualties from our last skirmish, sir.
Thank you, Naka. I spoke with Lieutenant Marks, and he intercepted a radio transmission...
Kanchou. You're bleeding at the temple.

Fields.MenuText: I might have rattled my head a little during the last battle, but it's nothing serious.
Oh, come now, Naka. A captain must lead the ship, scratches be damned.
I have been seeing double lately. Do you have a twin?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing serious? I demand that you retire to your quarters immediately. I'll radio the mess hall for nigiri and sake.
The Kanchou can't lead if the Kanchou is concussed. Please, don't let your pride injure you.
We need a nurse, now.
I have news about Sendai. If we don't act now, we might lose the initiative.
Any news can wait until you're lying down, safely. I insist. Let me escort you.
I can walk myself to my quarters, I don't want to keep you from your duties.
Naka?
Sir, if I leave you alone, will you actually go to your quarters?
Perhaps your guiding hand would help.
Hello, Kanchou. How is that head feeling?

Fields.MenuText: Never better. I could smash it through a hull and feel nothing.
The sake really helped. Very tempting to have another round...
Kiss it and make it better?

Fields.DialogueText: It's good to see your spirits are restored.
One is enough for today. You are the kanchou, after all.
A kanchou shouldn't act like a child.
Captain, I have that intercepted radio transmission you asked for.
Present it immediately, Lieutenant.
We intercepted a communication from Sendai. It was very garbled, but we could make out something about reclaiming glory for the Emperor.
That's not much to go on. Are we able to get a location?
The horizon of the Empire of the Sun? Expand the horizon of the Empire of the Sun to where sea meets sea. That's what it said.
Conquest? He's thinking about conquest now?
This will lead to chaos amongst the Protection Fleet. We have to stop him.
*ALARM*
Kanchou, Morganas are approaching from both sides. They're trying to flank us.
To arms.
@BATTLE
Naka, you seem troubled. Please, unburden your mind.
Dōmo arigatō gozaimasu. Kanchou, I simply can't allow for my sister ship to be used to undermine the Neutrality Fleet. We can't fight each other and the Morganas.
Lady Naka, I couldn't agree more. It's our duty to stop her - and I promise that we will. On my honor as captain.
I admire your resolve, Kanchou. I am worried, however. The Pacific is vast; we have no idea where Noda may have headed.
Walk with me to the bridge. Let's confer with Officer Furuichi and Lieutenant Marks.
Captain on deck.

Fields.MenuText: At ease, Lieutenant.
What news have we of Sendai?
Were you two holding hands?

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, sir.
We have eliminated seventy five percent of the Pacific as her target, sir.
Navigating is a two person job.
Bring up a potential map of her targets.
We haven't heard any reports of activity in the Philippines or Indonesia, and I don't think Kanchou Noda would attack Australia or New Zealand with just one light cruiser.
But from all accounts they were last seen heading eastward. Pearl Harbor has been on high alert since the Morganas first appeared - that's not exactly a soft target.
I'm not having any brilliant ideas, Captain.
Never give up, Lieutenant. There are no dead ends, only weak men.
Kanchou, what about Peru? I understand there's a significant Japanese population there. If Kanchou Noda has delusions about expanding the Empire...
Or further south. Remember the "Sea to sea" business? He doesn't have a hope of getting through the Panama Canal, but if he wants to go from the Pacific to the Atlantic...
The southern tip of South America? A navigator's nightmare.
Marks. Radio the fleet - we have to stop that ship. And, Furuichi, set a southeasterly course - if I'm wrong and Noda has designs on Peru, we'll still hear about it.
And we'll intervene before Sendai makes a mistake from which we cannot recover.
Aye, Captain.
Sir, that may have to hold on a moment, the Morgana fleet is approaching.
Understood. Man the guns.
@BATTLE
What, the Strait of Magellan?
Kanchou. I have urgent news. I have made contact with Sendai.
Fantastic work! Do we have her bearings? What can you tell me?
Unfortunately, very little.  Gomen'nasai. She is in great distress, that's all. However, we are on the right course.
How can you tell?
The stirrings have grown stronger as we have steamed forward.
I sincerely hope you're right. We only have one chance to avert an international disaster.
Kanchou, have you thought of what you will do when we locate Sendai?

Fields.MenuText: Blundering in and making it up as I go is my forte, Naka.
Whatever it takes. We have to view Sendai as a pirate ship, not a member of the fleet.
It's either diplomacy or a big, wooden horse.

Fields.DialogueText: I understand we're in the heat of battle, but you need to devise a plan.
You don't mean to rain down fire upon Sendai, do you? She's done nothing wrong.
Kanchou, this isn't a laughing matter!
It's a tricky issue, but I hope to take Noda peacefully if at all possible. He had some unfortunate biases when we spoke, but he didn't seem beyond reason.
Mutiny can change a man, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
We're needed on the bridge, Kanchou. Your orders?
Let's crush the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Argh. This is impossible. She is refusing all radio contact.
I still can't establish a visual. We're flying blind.
No, we're not. Sendai's stirrings are stronger and louder. Adjust course ten degrees south, Officers.
Yes, Ma'am.
I'm so glad we have a Belle on this ship, Kanchou. Without her, we would never have discovered Noda's plans.
She's right, sir. Even I have to admit she grows on you.
Whoah.
I'm picking up tremendous radio interference. AGH! Morgana fleet approaching through the fog!
No visual yet, sir. I trust Lieutenant Marks. Prepare to engage.
@BATTLE
Officers! To your stations! We need to defend from these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Damage to the hull. Guns jammed. New fires have broken out on the deck. I repeat, fires on the deck.

Fields.MenuText: I'm on it, Naka. Everything is under control.
Would you calm down about the fires? We need a little excitement every once in a while.
Any casualties?

Fields.DialogueText: Your steely resolve is noted, Kanchou, but please tend to the fires.
I can't see with the smoke, sir. It overwhelms me. How would you feel if your body was on FIRE?
I can't tell yet, Kanchou. It's difficult to focus past the fires.
Lieutenant Marks!
Sorry for the wait, Captain. It's mayhem on the deck.
Divert all available men to the fire brigade. Get those deck fires under control ASAP.
Yes, sir. Lady Naka, we'll have your ship stabilized immediately.
That's better. I feel the water washing over my deck. I can concentrate again.
We make a good team, Naka. Both of us serve as the calming voice to the other.
Kanchou, if I didn't know better, I'd accuse you of being too familiar.

Fields.MenuText: We have a great working rapport. That is all.
Shouldn't a captain be familiar with the ship?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes. A working rapport. I agree.
A kanchou should lead in accordance to military regulation.
Has the damage been brought under enough control to sense Sendai?
Yes. She is fighting against him, Noda. She knows she can't last against him forever, but she's giving it all she's got.
What can we do to assist her?
Intercept her as soon as possible.
Right. Increase speed by five knots.
Hai, Kanchou.
Captain. We received word from aerial recon units that Sendai has been spotted - 100 nautical miles from our position.
At our speed, we should have visual on her within a relatively short period of time.
Excellent.
Hai. Of course, she will also have visual on us.
Whoa. Where'd you come from?
Lady Naka. How much have you heard?
I'm the Belle of this ship. I hear everything..
Then that means, you heard... uh-oh. Ah.
Lieutenant Marks sure is jumpy. He always is one to speak his mind. Should I go after him?

Fields.MenuText: Be my guest, Officer.
He needs some privacy. At least the illusion of it.
Let me grab you a bottle of wine.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, sir. I'll be back in five.
Privacy, on a ship at war? He's needed on the deck.
Huh? Oh, haha, you must be joking. Ehhehe?
I think it would be best if we knock out Sendai's engines as soon as we have the chance. We're too close to civilian traffic to be gentle.
Sendai will see this as a betrayal. She has been rebelling against Noda for our benefit. That could turn her against us.
That's a chance I'm willing to risk. We can't afford the consequences otherwise.
As you are the kanchou, you have the right to make this decision.
It's not an easy call.
If you fire on her, however, I will never forgive you.
*ALARM*
Your orders, sir?
Conversation tabled. The Morganas must be stopped.
@BATTLE
What am I going to do? I can't risk all out war, but I can't be at war with my own ship.
On top of that, she can hear me as I monologue.
Having a crisis of inaction, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Where did you come from?
That's not your place, Lieutenant.
I'll take all the help I can get.

Fields.DialogueText: Got back from the galley. Have a can of peaches.
I apologize, sir. I merely was offering guidance.
Glad to hear it, Captain. Two heads are better than one.
Lieutenant, how can I be expected to stop Sendai without turning Naka against me?
That's difficult, Captain. Firing upon Sendai is the bluntest solution to the first issue, but destroys the trust between you and Naka.
Also, Noda is a powerful captain. There's no guarantee the first plan would even work. He could still attack the straits, and then you're in double the trouble.
I see your point, Lieutenant. Firing is a terrible course of action. However, we still don't have any better options.
What about convincing Noda to not attack?
Well, that was my original hope, but since they're not even deigning to answer when we hail them...
Unless. Unless, he thought we wanted to join him.
Exactly. Wait, what?
*ALARM*
Let's get to the bridge and dispatch these Morganas. I have a plan.
@BATTLE
All right, all right. Gift, then plan. Gift, plan. Ahem, Lady Naka?
You called, Kanchou?
I, uh, have a gift for you. Freshly caught sea bass, off of our deck.
Oh. Kanchou. I... don't know what to say.

Fields.MenuText: You don't have to say anything. This is just a peace offering.
Say you're not mad at me.
I, uh. *ahem* Uh, Naka. *ahem*

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou. There was no need.
Why would I be mad at you?
Kanchou, would you please speak up?
I apologize for suggesting we torpedo your sister ship. There is never a dead end, Naka.
I accept your apology, sir. The bond I have with my sister is of the highest importance to me. I am glad we are working to resolve this crisis peacefully.
Kanchou. Crisis. Morgana fleet approaching from the rear.
@BATTLE
The plan is simple. We pull alongside Sendai, with a white flag flown.
As long as she won't accept radio transmissions, visual is the only way we can communicate.
Correct. We wait until we have visual confirmation of Captain Noda, and then show him we have Naka taken hostage. Naka, are you sure you are comfortable with this?
Hai. If it is for the good of the ship, the fleet, and civilization, then I'm eager to do it.
Now, Lady Naka can't be further than ten yards from the ship, so we have to convince Kanchou Noda to then come aboard. That's up to you, Kanchou.
I hope you've worked on your lying skills, sir.
Perhaps we should practice beforehand.
Excellent. I'll play Noda. Kanchou. I SEE YOU HAVE COME TO YOUR SENSES AND WILL JOIN ME IN CASTING ASIDE THESE ANTI-NATIONALIST PRETENSES.
Oh, gee...

Fields.MenuText: Yes, Captain. I have brought this one as my prisoner. We must rid the world of the Belles - or at least keep them in their place!
You better believe it, skipper. Let's have a rice beer to celebrate.
Yes, I did come to my senses. Now come to my ship where I definitely won't double cross you.

Fields.DialogueText: Nicely done. A little scary, though...
Clever idea. Noda is fond of rice beer and definitely won't refuse an offer.
You can do better than that, Kanchou.
IMPRESSIVE! LET ME JOIN YOU IN YOUR QUARTERS WHERE WE SHALL CELEBRATE. HAHAHA!
The power has gone to his head.
He has an impressively deep voice. Oh my.
Let's keep calm, team. We're so close to our target.
Heavy fog rolling in from the southeast.
Naka, are you all right?
Full steam ahead. For the sake of Sendai, I will brave a little fog.
CAPTAIN Noda EMBRACES THE COVER OF THE FOG. HAHAHA! ISN'T THAT RIGHT, LOVELY Furuichi?
Morganas approaching.
Noda FEARS NO SHIP. HAHA! I SHALL CONQUER THEM IN YOUR HONOR.
No, seriously, Morganas approaching from the fog.
Snap out of it, you hopeless romantic.
To arms. Engage the fleet.
@BATTLE
Incoming attack! We need to protect our ship! Officers, to your stations!
@BATTLE
Sendai sighted, Kanchou. Our white flag is flying, but no response.
It must be the fog, sir. They can't see us, let alone our flag.
Send a signal flare. Get their attention any way possible.
Hai.
How do you plan to subdue Noda once he's aboard?
Furuichi and Marks and I will corner him in the officers' Mess and hold him hostage.
Sendai is my sister ship. I know of Noda's prowess. He comes from a powerful Shizoku in Satsuma. His family traces their lineage to the time of the samurai.

Fields.MenuText: Guns will trump swords.
Nobody told me he was a samurai.
So, we'll need to get him drunk first...

Fields.DialogueText: Please be careful.
I didn't want any surprises, but I have faith in you.
If you think that's the most noble decision...
Kanchou. Sendai has responded. They're pulling alongside us, and their kanchou is on deck.
Are the cuffs too tight, Naka?
...Let's finish this, for the sake of Sendai.
Kanchou. You have made a wise choice. Are you ready to cast aside these Belles and fight for what really matters?

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely, Captain. I have taken the Belle prisoner. She can't, however, leave the ship, so please come aboard and let's discuss the terms of engaging the enemy.
FOR LAND AND GLORY. Come have a rice beer with me as we celebrate expanding the Empire of the sun.
I'm tired. Let's get this over with. Come aboard and tell me your plan.

Fields.DialogueText: You're an incredible kanchou. Someday, you'll make admiral with this leadership. Show me the way.
Rice beer. I've been stuck drinking sake for the last month. Hurry.
Sounds more like we're negotiating your surrender than anything. Perhaps we should get you a cup of tea.
I can't believe you would betray me, Kanchou.
Silence, Belle. Captain Noda, this way to the officers' mess.
I do hope there's food available. All these battles have left me ravenous.
This rice beer is fantastic. It brings me great joy to have you serving on my side.
I must admit, your words spoke to me.
These Morganas are mere distraction. I wouldn't be surprised if they were an enemy invention, Kanchou. So many countries will do anything to extinguish the light of Japan.
So, Tierra Del Fuego is next, then? The Straits of Magellan?
Occupying a vital position where East meets West, the Empire would finally have a port to the Atlantic.
How can we fight both the Morganas and the rest of the world at the same time?
The Morganas will disappear once the Belles are imprisoned. You'll see. Now that you have your Belle hostage, the attacks will cease.
Kanchou. Morganas approaching. It's a swarm.
We have mere minutes until attack.
What?
Stay here where it is safe, Captain. Lieutenant Marks will protect you.
I will?
You better believe it.
Where are they coming from? Sendai?
We'll radio her. No harm will come to her. Furuichi, to the bridge.
@BATTLE
The fog is aiding our enemies. It needs to dissipate soon.
It certainly isn't improving our visuals. I can barely keep an eye on Sendai.
As long as Noda is secured, we're all right.
I hope Lieutenant Marks is as well. Noda is intimidating, and Lieutenant Marks isn't the burliest.
Don't let him catch you saying that.
Did I say that outloud?

Fields.MenuText: Can't it wait until we pull into port, Officer?
This is getting out of hand.
See no evil, hear no evil.

Fields.DialogueText: There's nothing to wait for, sir.
I haven't the slightest idea what you're talking about.
Exactly as it should be.
Sendai still seems to be in great distress. She's stirring. I need to calm her.
What can we do to help?
It's this fog. I can't concentrate with it. I won't be able to form a proper connection until it's gone.
Don't look now, but Morganas approaching again.
Hopefully the seas of war will clear this fog.
@BATTLE
The fog seems to be clearing, but it's still too thick.
YOU!
AAAGH!
I tried to stop him, but he was too fast. His sword cut my gun in two.
She's not your prisoner at all. This is a trap. I'm not falling for it. Let me off this ship, or I'll cleave you in two.
Not so fast, Kanchou. I refuse to let you touch a single sailor on my ship, even if I have to shoot you myself. And I assure you, unlike the Lieutenant, I will find my mark.
It's too late! Sendai is set to fire upon the straits within the minute. My fail-safe in case you failed to return me.
This will mean all out war.
No. HRRRN! HRRRRYAAAAH!
What is happening?
The fog has lifted. She's, she's... she's redirecting the fire of Sendai! The shells are falling into the water.
KYAAAH!
Impossible. No Belle could stop a samurai. You're a demon, and I'll send you straight to hell. HYAAAAH!
If this is what you wish...
Oh. Oh, by the kami. It's so cold...
Did you see that? She twisted his own sword around on him. Felled by his own blade.
Tenno, forgive me.
Your head was misguided, but your honor restored.
@BATTLE
There they are! Get ready, crewmen, we can defeat them this time!
@BATTLE
And balance is restored.
We did it. We saved the world. Well, at least for a day...
You should have seen Naka. Such grace, such poise. Such calm under pressure.
I was great too, right?
The best. Never better, heh.
That was an incredible plan, Kanchou. Sendai is safe. Thank you.
It's all thanks to you, Naka. That ability to command fire was... almost unbelievable. You saved us.
What is it, Naka?

Fields.MenuText: As long as I am captain, I will never rest until all Morganas are defeated and the world knows the Belles fought to save us.
I feel that a cup of tea and fried salmon will fix this. Care to join me in the officers' mess?

Fields.DialogueText: Your conviction is incredible, Kanchou!
As long as there is some for Marks and Furuichi as well. Our crew needs thanks.
Has Sendai stopped stirring?
Hai, Kanchou. She, she is happy. She is ready to serve her purpose. To defend civilization.
She trusts you?
She trusts me, as I now trust my kanchou.
Guide her then, Naka.
Sir.
Guide Sendai as you see fit.
Hai, Kanchou. With pleasure. Light Cruisers Sendai and Naka: launch salute!
